search.query: `cs_sysmon_deploy_audit_data` ("Sysmon already up to date" OR "Install complete!" OR "sysmon_version") | fields host, sysmon_version | eval sysmon_install_status="Updated" | eval sysmon_version = replace(sysmon_version, "(.*\s)([vV][\d\.]+)(\s.*)", "\2") | stats first(*) as * by host | append [| search `cs_sysmon_deploy_audit_data` ("No updates found" OR "Update found, installing" OR "No config update found" OR "config update found, installing") | dedup host | eval sysmon_config_status="Updated" | table host sysmon_config_status] | append [| search `cs_sysmon` | fields host | stats count by host| table host | eval data="Present"] | stats first(*) as * by host | fillnull data value="Absent" | fillnull sysmon_install_status, sysmon_config_status, sysmon_version value="-" | sort sysmon_install_status, sysmon_config_status, data | table host, sysmon_install_status, sysmon_config_status, sysmon_version, data

html.p: This search checks the last twenty-four hours of data to find the Sysmon deployment status.
Click on any host to view Sysmon deployment status related events for further troubleshooting.

panel.title: TA Sysmon Deploy and Maintain Events for $tkn_drilldown_host$

search.query: `cs_sysmon_deploy_audit_data` host=$tkn_drilldown_host|s$ | rex field=_raw "\w+\s\d+\/\d+\/\d+-\s?\d+:\d+:\d+\.\d+\s(?<status>.+)" | eval status=trim(status) | dedup status | where status="No updates found" | append [search `cs_sysmon_deploy_audit_data` host=$tkn_drilldown_host|s$ | rex field=_raw "\w+\s\d+\/\d+\/\d+-\s?\d+:\d+:\d+\.\d+\s(?<status>.+)" | eval status=trim(status) | where status!="No updates found"] | table _time, status

table.title: Sysmon is Installed but Splunk Unable to Read Symon Logs

search.query: index=_internal $tkn_host_error_message$ sourcetype="splunkd" CASE(ERROR) "Microsoft-Windows-Sysmon/Operational" | dedup host, event_message | table host, _time, event_message | rename _time as last_error | `cs_human_readable_time_format(last_error)` | append [search `cs_sysmon_deploy_audit_data` $tkn_host_error_message$ ("No updates found" OR "Install complete!") | dedup host | table host | eval ta_sysmon_deploy_status="Sysmon Installed"] | stats last(*) as * by host | search event_message=* ta_sysmon_deploy_status=* | table host, last_error, event_message

table.title: Error in Sysmon Deploy App in Batch File Execution

search.query: index=_internal $tkn_host_error_message$ sourcetype="splunkd" source="*splunkd*" sysmon ERROR "TA-Sysmon-deploy" | rex "ExecProcessor\]\s-\s(?<mymessage>.*)" | eval event_message=coalesce(mymessage, event_message) | table host, _time, event_message | sort 0 host, _time

html.p: App is deployed, but Splunk is unable to read the Sysmon logs for some reason. Try restarting Splunk UF on the host to resolve the problem. Also, check EventViewer on the host to see if the Sysmon logs are present under Application Logs > Microsoft > Windows > Sysmon.
